result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Katherine Lee Thyssen was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
States moves to amend count #1 to straight OWI 3rd Misd.  Court grants request.   Dismiss and read-in Count 2 and 14CM310.  DEF enters NC plea, Found guilty.    Court on Count 1 sentences DEF to:   The defendant shall serve 140 days in home detention/electronic monitoring pursuant to section 973.03(4), to be monitored by the STOP program.  16 days credit.    Fine and costs  $3,341.00, bond $250 applied to fines/costs,   30 days to pay or complete payment plan application.  Licenses revoked for 30 months plus 140 days   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.   IID installed for 30 Months, effective  8/3/2015.  On any vehicle owned or operated.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations,   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.
Report to STOP program immediately.

Defendant Katherine Lee Thyssen in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  States moves to amend count #1 to straight OWI 3rd Misd.  Court grants request.   Dismiss and read-in Count 2 and 14CM310.  DEF enters NC plea, Found guilty.    Court on Count 1 sentences DEF to:   The defendant shall serve 140 days in home detention/electronic monitoring pursuant to section 973.03(4), to be monitored by the STOP program.  16 days credit.    Fine and costs  $3,341.00, bond $250 applied to fines/costs,   30 days to pay or complete payment plan application.  Licenses revoked for 30 months plus 140 days   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.   IID installed for 30 Months, effective  8/3/2015.  On any vehicle owned or operated.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations,   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.
Report to STOP program immediately.

DEF advised of rights, waives preliminary hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Katherine Lee Thyssen in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Off the Record - DEF in Stop Program.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Katherine Lee Thyssen in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, waives time limits for preliminary, DEF in courts IDIP program  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.

STOP Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a stop case manager (715-638-3317) for the purpose of setting up a procedure to monitor compliance with the bond provisions.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
Defendant may not be on the premises of any establishment that serves alcohol by the drink.
